title: Is an asteroid going to hit the Earth in 2029? What about 2035? Could we, by that time, protect ourselves by changing its trajectory? - Quora

response.answer_text: Is an asteroid going to hit the Earth in 2029? What about 2035? Could we, by that time, protect ourselves by changing its trajectory? If you mean 99942 Apophis, it will be closer than geosynchronous satellites on April 13 2029, but no closer than 31,200 km. The pass in 2036 will be about 1000 times further away. There’s a possibility for an impact in 2068 (1 in 256,0000). If it hits, it will impact with a force equivalent top 750 megatons, about 14 times more powerful than the Tsar Bomba. If it hits deep water, there will be a tsunami that will be destructive in 1000 km, and if it hits land, it will make a roughly 5 km wide crater. In either case, it’s unlikely to be long-lasting effects.

In 2029, the asteroid known as 99942 Apophis is supposed to make a close approach to earth at a distance of 38000 km. In 2036, Apophis is supposed to pass again. It could possibly hit either time. As for when we could redirect an asteroid, I’m not sure. That technology is still most likely many decades away.
